Reviews.Content: Home Away From Home I've lost count of the number of times I've stayed here--individually, as a director for study abroad, and with a small group of friends. it's my home when I'm in Mexico City. The staff always greet me like an old friend, even when a year has passed. They go out of their way to make sure that my stay goes well, are competitive in price and service, have the perfect location, rooms are clean and comfortable, include breakfast and internet (which admittedly falters sometimes)...they made an emergency room change for me (long story, but they even sent someone to the room to help me collect my things and to make sure I was safe) and had someone run around town in the middle of the night to get me medicine when I was sick...did I mention they treat me like an old friend? ;-) Seriously, if you are looking for a place to stay in Mexico City, you don't need to look any further. My only warning is that you will want all of your hotel stays to be like this one!
Reviews.Author: hokiehawk

Reviews.Content: Perfect Location, Pleasant Staff, Best Deal This is the type of Hotel that makes your vacation all the more enjoyable. For like $60 you get a clean hotel, fantastic breakfast buffet, and a safe area that is very convenient. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again!
Reviews.Author: DrLisbon

Reviews.Content: Location, location, location The price and location can not be beat, Between two metro stops as well as the buses on Insurgentes and Paseo de la Reforma. Close to Chapultepec, Polanco, Roma, Centro Historico and right outside of the Zona Rosa. The area is safe IMO, never felt uncomfortable or threatened. The rooms are basic, very clean and comfortable. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Relax and enjoy a nice hotel in an amazing, hypnotizing city.
Reviews.Author: trusk_01

Reviews.Content: Good choice Stayed here for one week in January. We paid AUD$32.00 per night for a king bedded room. Room is basic, but very clean. Bathroom was large and clean. We were sort of in the middle of the hotel on the 3rd floor with a view of the fire stairs. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Hotel was in a safe neighbourhood and close to everything. We walked to the centre of Mexico most of the time (about 30 minutes) but the trains are not that far and a quite easy to use (although it is very rare that you can get to where you want to go without changing trains at least once). We didn't try the restaurant, there are just too many vendors and restaurants etc around to spend the time in the hotel. There is a guy who sells great taco's just around the corner. Wasn't overly mad on Zona Rosa nightlife (thankfully not right on the hotels doorstep), too many strip joints, hookers and pimps for my liking, but saying that we never felt unsafe. Overall though the hotel was the best bargain on our six week holiday. BEWARE of dutyfree alcohol and perfumes etc at the airport, they are more expensive than buying it in Mexico city, such a rip off.
Reviews.Author: Craigy

Reviews.Content: The Yes, But hotel As many reviewers have noted, this hotel is a bargain. It definitely was satisfactory and worth the price; I would stay there again. That said, there are areas where the hotel really needs to improve. Most of the points are minor, but they added up and really detracted from our stay. For example, on the hotel website, the following amenities are listed:Filtered water: YES, BUT this really means that one small bottle of filtered water is provided per guest, per day. In room safes: YES, BUT they aren't bolted down. You can lock your valuables in them, but anyone can walk away with the entire small safe.Wireless internet: YES, BUT there is a charge to get the password to be able to acess it.Business center: YES, BUT the printer doesn't work (so, you can't, for example, print out your boarding passes).This was the biggest problem:The hotel is not air conditioned (and doesn't really need to be given the moderate climate). YES, BUT there are no screens on any of the windows! You can't open the windows during mosquito season without screens (we tried and were nearly eaten alive). It can get quite hot with the windows closed, no fan, and no ac. The staff shrugged when we complained about the missing screens. We wound up sleeping wearing mosquito repellant and going out and buying cheesecloth to cover the windows.Again, the hotel is a good value, and I would stay there again, but the lack of very basic amenities--like screened windows during mosquito season--really needs to be addressed.
Reviews.Author: JR434

Reviews.Content: Hidden Treasure he hotel is a hidden treasure for budget minded travelers. First of all, it is located very close (a 3-4 minute walk) to Zona Rosa, an area with lots of bars, clubs, and restaurants. It is considered to be a safe area too. Lots of people can be seen walking down the streets very late at night. Zona Rosa is also known as a gay meca, so you will see guys walking hand in hand and sometimes kissing each other. The hotel building doesn't look fancy at all. In fact, it looks like an apartment building rather than a hotel. It has a small lobby as well. However, the hotel has been recently remodeled and rooms have new Scandinavian style furniture. My room and a bathroom were kept miraculously clean. My room had basic amenities such as a telephone, cable TV, and a safe. It also was very quite, which allowed me to have a good rest after sight seeing and nights out. The queen size bed was comfortable as well. The staff was very helpful. They also have a close circuit cameras in the hallways that show that they take security of their guests seriously. Don't expect luxury amenities at Del Principado. However, if you are looking for a cosy, comfortable and cheap place in Mexico City, give it a try... I am going to Mexico City on November 30, 2007 and for sure will be staying there!
Reviews.Author: Forestparkguy60130

Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel. Great location easy walk to many places of interest ...cheap cab ride or metro to the rest...quiet...a wonderly helpful staff who are always friendly...very nice breakfast included...only downside was I can live without air conditioning but a ceiling fan would have been nice...great price...7 -11 half block away...This will become my new home in Mexico City when I visit.
Reviews.Author: MontroseTop

Reviews.Content: Cheap and Compfortable Hotel The Hotel has very good location, near from ZOna ROsa, Condesa and principals Avenues and sightings of Mexico CIty, its a good deal fro the price. If you are looking for a place decent to stay with amenities for stay without luxuty this its the place to stay in. Please dont make call direct from the hotel its too expensive. The personal staff is so kind and helpfull. Its 2 blcks from mexica Gay zone.
Reviews.Author: VenezuelaTraveler

Reviews.Content: Best value breakfast in Mexico! We were very happy with our choice of Del Principado for our visit to Mexico city. We stayed 5 nights at the beginning of our trip and when we returned for another 2 at the end, it felt like coming home. Rooms clean, staff friendly - the receptionist was particularly helpful with advice on places to go. The breakfast buffet was excellent - it wasn't included when booking online but cost only 50 pesos (US$5, 鈧?.50). If you book direct with hotel it's included. Unlimited amounts of fresh fruit, cereals, yogurt, juice, pastries, and a selection of hot dishes, including Mexican ones, which varied every day, and of course coffee, bread and rolls. Lots of locals seemed to come in for breakfast on their way to work.
Reviews.Author: magpie15

Reviews.Content: excellent choose im stayed at the hotel for a weekend ....excellent service....staff was very friendly ..good location and also the prices was great.. rooms was very clean and had good size....the had services for internet at room for a very low cost. soo bring your lap top...the only i miss was the A/C but the weather was great soo no need the A/C...hotel is a few step from zona rosa where you can find restaurant and shops....i recommend hotel del principado...Ramon/Miami, Fl
Reviews.Author: latino069

Reviews.Content: Decent, modern rooms with free wirless Internet...excellent value! I've stayed here 3 times  cannot fault it (except for the lift breaking down a couple of times, but hey!). Rooms are spacious, nicely furnished  modern. Free wireless internet throughout the hotel. Location is good for restaurants  entertainment, plus right next to main Insurgentes road, lots of taxis, nearby metro. Most of the staff are friendly  welcoming. Breakfast is plentiful. All in all, great for budget travellers, business  tourist alike...Ps450/500 a night! ($1 = Ps11).
Reviews.Author: Rushun

Reviews.Content: overall good except.................. I was pleased with what I received and agree with all previous good reviews written about this hotel. I DO need, however, to mention that the room was very musty smelling and no matter the amout of oust / febreze that I sprayed on everything, the smell would not go away. This either made me not sleep too well, or I just have a very sensitive nose. The other disappointment that I had ,was that they have an internet area, however no printer. I was hoping to check in for my flight and print up my boarding pass before leaving the hotel for the airport. They need to get a printer for their internet area.
Reviews.Author: mexcolt
